channel.title: RipScape Deobber
channel.description:
I am writing and creating a repack of all usefull stuff regarding the client and the decompiling/deobbing. My goal: writing a script that does it all! Feel free to edit/fix/add anything as long as you post the improvements here. Any help is appreciated.
-It downloads the latest runescape files and unpack them. -It will convert .pack200 into .jar -It deobs and renames runescape.jar using ZKM and Deobber.jar -It automaticly creates runningbot and compile scripts. -It decompiles with both jad and jode in seperate directorys... -It gets the latest RuneScape cache from your computer (must have run latest rs once!) -It Compiles the clientlibs (jagex3 and jaggl) seperately to enable HD and fullscreen modes. -The awesome z-filesearcher is included! :d usefull to find certain lines of code. -Jar command included -Will now detect if you have Java and JDK installed, if not, it downloads it. -Added a URLClassLoader, wich will load any client from a url and runs it (always up to date client for your users, Adjust it to your own website, will soon add cache loader) -And its only one small file of 2,4mb
*Made for a Windows OS on the c:\ drive
Latest version: 1.5 [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?ezdhzzkim0y]Mediafire - RipScape.rar V1.5[/url] [url=http://www.filefactory.com/file/a2h9eee/n/RipScape_V1.5.rar]FileFactory - RipScape.rar V1.5[/url]
*Run RipScape *You will now have to fix the compile errors in either jode or jad. Things that one havnt decompiled correctly, may be correct with the other. Try both and good luck :D
Just deobbed and fixed client 578 with HD and Fullscreen :D (thats latest as of 23 dec 2009) Working with paldino76 562 server (now 578)
Credits: Me for the script and classloader Popcorn for the idea, and deobber and zkm i used Creators of jad and jode for their tools. Sun for all java stuff

item.title: RipScape Deobber
item.dc:creator: @TeraScape TeraScape
item.description:
@TeraScape wrote:

I havnt been working on this for a long time…
But now I m back:p

Added: a few lines of code wich check if you have for example an older deob, or java installed.
Added: a URLClassLoader wich loads the client from an URL. (so your users will always have the latest client)

I am currently working on implanting orignal code from the RuneScape Loader to make it download and load the cache.
If you know how to do this, or have any code to speed things up a bit, please post it here.
Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: RipScape Deobber
item.dc:creator: @Espeon Espeon
item.description:
@Espeon wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:44, topic:321503”][quote author=Espeon link=topic=417957.msg3076682#msg3076682 date=1261879286]

'ping' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.


[/quote]

All the ping does, is pause the batch files state for a second, and then continue after. Dont worry about it if it doesn’t recognize it, it just wont pause, but it will continue through the long list of commands it will be doing.[/quote]

Oh, thanks. I’m also getting other errors though. Let’s see how it does in the end.

Read full topic

item.title: RipScape Deobber
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Espeon, post:43, topic:321503”] 'ping' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

:([/quote]

All the ping does, is pause the batch files state for a second, and then continue after. Dont worry about it if it doesn’t recognize it, it just wont pause, but it will continue through the long list of commands it will be doing.

Read full topic

item.title: RipScape Deobber
item.dc:creator: @r_r_r r r r
item.description:
@r_r_r wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:39, topic:321503”][quote author=r r r link=topic=417957.msg3076171#msg3076171 date=1261852650]

Well I fixed the problem with the netscape. Now where does it load the cache from. Theres nothing in the client that says where it loads it from, nothing even about that cache.

Heh, you noticed the same thing as me then.

Yeah its strange. I would have thought it would be in Class142, which I believe is singlink.

I did used a searcher and searched for C:/ and c:/ (capes makes a difference in the searcher i use). It came up short, so, im thinking its actually an imput method they used to name where the cache is located, but im not 100% positive on that.

Yeah lol I have searched for every like that to. I can’t even find anything on main_file_cache.idx or like random.dat. Nothing.

The only thing i can think of, is that its loaded from a web-page now, instead of your computer itself. It is possible, just, why now.

-Edit
I finally dumped the mapdata I wanted, also dumped it so I can use it on a 317. But as CoonHunter said the cache is loaded from a web-page because I deleted the cache in my client folder and the .jagex_cache_32 in C:/ and I still was able to get on runescape.
[/quote]

I didnt have the cache in the first place (new comp) and i could play, thats where i got the threory. I am doing random things i can think of to try to get the cache, just gotta find out where its located.[/quote]
Well its not getting the cache, its trying to find where it loads and disabling it. Then making it load from somewhere else.

Read full topic

item.title: RipScape Deobber
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:

Well I fixed the problem with the netscape. Now where does it load the cache from. Theres nothing in the client that says where it loads it from, nothing even about that cache.

Heh, you noticed the same thing as me then.

Yeah its strange. I would have thought it would be in Class142, which I believe is singlink.

I did used a searcher and searched for C:/ and c:/ (capes makes a difference in the searcher i use). It came up short, so, im thinking its actually an imput method they used to name where the cache is located, but im not 100% positive on that.

Yeah lol I have searched for every like that to. I can’t even find anything on main_file_cache.idx or like random.dat. Nothing.

The only thing i can think of, is that its loaded from a web-page now, instead of your computer itself. It is possible, just, why now.
[/quote]
-Edit
I finally dumped the mapdata I wanted, also dumped it so I can use it on a 317. But as CoonHunter said the cache is loaded from a web-page because I deleted the cache in my client folder and the .jagex_cache_32 in C:/ and I still was able to get on runescape.[/quote]

I didnt have the cache in the first place (new comp) and i could play, thats where i got the threory. I am doing random things i can think of to try to get the cache, just gotta find out where its located.

Read full topic

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:37, topic:321503”][quote author=r r r link=topic=417957.msg3076169#msg3076169 date=1261852414]

Well I fixed the problem with the netscape. Now where does it load the cache from. Theres nothing in the client that says where it loads it from, nothing even about that cache.

Heh, you noticed the same thing as me then.

Yeah its strange. I would have thought it would be in Class142, which I believe is singlink.

I did used a searcher and searched for C:/ and c:/ (capes makes a difference in the searcher i use). It came up short, so, im thinking its actually an imput method they used to name where the cache is located, but im not 100% positive on that.

Yeah lol I have searched for every like that to. I can’t even find anything on main_file_cache.idx or like random.dat. Nothing.
[/quote]

The only thing i can think of, is that its loaded from a web-page now, instead of your computer itself. It is possible, just, why now.[/quote]

I finally dumped the mapdata I wanted, also dumped it so I can use it on a 317. But as CoonHunter said the cache is loaded from a web-page because I deleted the cache in my client folder and the .jagex_cache_32 in C:/ and I still was able to get on runescape.
